lines.text: [newlyweds Richard and Frances Myles register at a hotel under assumed names]
Mr. and Mrs. Smith? I suppose that's all right. Mind you draw the blinds.
[on their wedding night, a policeman appears at the Myles's hotel room door demanding Richard's depart with him immediately]
This is no time for a practical joke.
Darling, the less you know, or appear to know, the better.
That's what my mother told me the night I came out in Boston.
Richard, just think of what's ahead of us.

[thinking of his wedding night]
Yes... think of it.
I must get a hat, with a big red rose on it.
I gave you our German greeting, American!
